0.title: I-T portal not hacked, Infosys fixing issue: Govt as site suffers glitch on anniversary
0.article_body: The government said that there was no data breach on the Income Tax e-filing portal after its search option malfunctioned on the first anniversary of its launch. "Infosys has been directed to look into it and...has confirmed that they are resolving the issue on priority," said the Income Tax Department on Twitter.

1.title: British band Queen to drop unreleased Freddie Mercury song in September
1.article_body: An unreleased song by Freddie Mercury, recorded for his rock band Queen's 13th studio album The Miracle, will come out in September this year. Calling the song a "little gem from Freddie", Queen's Roger Taylor said that they had "kind of forgotten" about it. "It's wonderful, actually. It was a real discovery," Taylor further said.

2.title: Foakes is best wicketkeeper in the world: England Test skipper Stokes
2.article_body: Praising Ben Foakes, England Test skipper Ben Stokes said his teammate is "best wicketkeeper in the world". He added that having Foakes behind the stumps gives him and bowlers a lot of confidence. Stokes said bowlers know that nine times out of 10, Foakes is going to take everything that comes to him. Foakes has played 12 Tests so far.

3.title: 8 held for running parking racket near Gurugram's Galleria market
3.article_body: The Haryana Chief Minister's flying squad in a joint raid on Monday held eight people for allegedly running a parking racket near the Galleria market in Gurugram. An official from the flying squad said the accused had been running the racket for two months and collected at least ₹20,000-25,000 every day. The area is earmarked for free parking, officials said.

4.title: Johnny Depp-Amber Heard trial wristbands put on sale online for over ₹3.8 lakh
4.article_body: Several spectators who attended the defamation trial between Johnny Depp and Amber Heard in US' Virginia are now selling their paper wristbands online for over ₹3.8 lakh. "This is a piece of celebrity culture history," wrote one seller. The jury found that Heard defamed Depp and awarded him $10 million in compensatory damages and $5 million in punitive damages.

5.title: I played French Open with my left foot asleep because of anaesthetic injections: Nadal
5.article_body: Rafael Nadal, who won French Open for the 14th time, revealed that he played Roland Garros 2022 with his left foot asleep. "I played with no feeling in the foot...because of the anaesthetic injections into the nerve," he said. The 36-year-old added that it was "probably" the most unexpected title for him.

6.title: How does the latest Cricket World Cup Super League points table read?
6.article_body: After defeating Zimbabwe by eight wickets in the second ODI, Afghanistan jumped to the third position on the Cricket World Cup Super League points table. The table is being led by Bangladesh, while England are placed second. Zimbabwe are 12th with just three victories. Top-seven ranked teams and World Cup hosts (India) will automatically qualify for 2023 World Cup.

7.title: Juvenile home in UP's GB Nagar overcrowded: Officials
7.article_body: Officials of District Legal Services Authority (DLSA) on Monday observed that the juvenile home in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar is overcrowded. "A total of 142 'children in conflict with law' are detained in the observation home, but the total capacity is 100," juvenile home Superintendent Dharmendra Maurya said. Notably, children from other districts are also being kept at the facility.

8.title: Pitt accuses Jolie of inflicting harm on him by selling her stake in $28 mn wine firm
8.article_body: Brad Pitt has accused his ex-wife Angelina Jolie of trying to intentionally inflict harm on him by damaging the reputation of their jointly owned wine business, Château Miraval which they bought for $28.4 million in 2008. Pitt alleged that Jolie sold her stake to a company while having agreed to never sell their respective stakes without each other's consent.

9.title: Hyd police book BJP MLA for revealing gang-rape victim's identity
9.article_body: Hyderabad police have booked BJP MLA M Raghunandan Rao for allegedly revealing the identity of the 17-year-old gang-rape victim. According to the FIR, the complainant claimed that Rao had addressed a press conference related to the gang-rape case and released videos and pictures which revealed the minor's identity. This may have caused the victim "colossal distress", the complainant also stated.

10.title: Had my first drink with my parents, their friends: Nushrratt Bharuccha
10.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha said she had her first drink with her parents and their friends, adding that her entire family has been very open, progressive and supportive. Nushrratt stated that the conversation on sexual awareness happened in a "very normal" way in her house. Nushrratt will be next seen in 'Janhit Mein Jaari' where she plays a condom salesgirl.

11.title: There never was one like you: Meghana on Chiranjeevi Sarja's death anniversary
11.article_body: Meghana Raj took to Instagram to pen a note remembering her husband, Chiranjeevi Sarja, on his death anniversary. She shared an old picture of herself with Chiranjeevi and wrote, "You and me...for eternity. There never was one like you, and there will be none like you...You, Chiru...the one and only." Chiranjeevi passed away in 2020, after suffering a heart attack.

12.title: Pune woman to attempt non-stop cycling from Leh to Manali in 60 hours
12.article_body: Pune's ace ultra-cyclist Preeti Maske will be attempting a World Ultra Cycling record by pedalling from Leh to Manali within 60 hours. "I am training hard for this Leh-Manali non-stop high-altitude expedition," Preeti said. Reports said that she admitted that the most challenging part of the Leh-Manali expedition is sleep deprivation as it is a continuous, non-stop ride.

13.title: Special intro scene being designed for SRK in Salman’s Tiger 3: Report
13.article_body: A special introduction scene is being designed for Shah Rukh Khan's cameo in Salman Khan-starrer 'Tiger 3', a source close to the development told Pinkvilla. "The details of [the introduction scene] have been kept under wraps for now," the source added. The source stated that Salman will have a chopper-bound entry in Shah Rukh's 'Pathaan'.

14.title: Hardik is extremely valuable for India, can hit sixes anytime: Irfan
14.article_body: Irfan Pathan said Hardik Pandya is "extremely valuable" for Team India and can hit sixes anytime. "He has the ability to finish the game at...death, he can do that batting up the order as well," he added. Hardik, who last played for India in November 2021, has been named in India's 18-member squad for upcoming T20I series against South Africa.

15.title: Arjun replies as man comments he can 'never get in shape', says 'I don't hide behind pic'
15.article_body: Arjun Kapoor replied to an Instagram user after the latter said he can "never get in shape". "So, according to...you, being in shape is just having cuts on...body. The shift in mentality, the ability to show up and push hard...isn't the point of working out, right?" said Arjun. "I don't hide behind a pic of a torso," he added.

16.title: 8 of family killed, 1 injured as SUV collides with truck in Rajasthan
16.article_body: At least eight people of a family were killed and another was injured after the SUV they were travelling in collided head-on with a truck in Rajasthan's Barmer, police said. The victims were going to a wedding and the accident took place when they were only eight kilometres away from their destination, police added. The deceased included two minors.

17.title: Meta appoints Guy Rosen as its chief information security officer
17.article_body: Meta has appointed Guy Rosen as its first Chief Information Security Officer (CISO). In a memo seen by Reuters, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said he had asked Rosen to take on the role. Rosen said he "will continue to oversee and look across the breadth of safety and security risks the people who use our services...face".

18.title: ED seizes assets of Gupta Builders & Promoters in money laundering case
18.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday said it has seized an Audi car, ₹85 lakh in cash and documents during raids against Chandigarh-based Gupta Builders and Promoters in an alleged money laundering case. The builders are accused of cheating investors of ₹325 crore. ED's probe has found that homebuyers' money was used to purchase various personal assets by the firm's directors.

19.title: Google loses defamation case against Australian politician, told to pay $515,000
19.article_body: Google has been ordered to pay $515,000 (around ₹4 crore) to an Australian former lawmaker after losing a defamation case filed by him. An Australian court found that the company intentionally made money from two YouTube videos attacking and mocking John Barilaro, who was the then-deputy premier of New South Wales. They featured a comedian who accused Barilaro of corruption.

20.title: Nick Jonas limps to emergency room over softball injury, video viral
20.article_body: A video going viral on social media shows singer Nick Jonas limping into an emergency room in California's Encino after suffering an injury during a softball game. Nick appeared to be hit in the groin during the game on Sunday and nearly collapsed on the field. His brother Kevin Jonas drove him to the hospital in a Land Rover.

21.title: Cinema is my oxygen, Vikram's success is not just mine but good cinema's: Kamal
21.article_body: The official handle of Raaj Kamal Films International shared a video of actor Kamal Haasan thanking all the film lovers for their support towards his new film 'Vikram'. He said that cinema is his oxygen and the success of 'Vikram' is not just his but also a win for good cinema. He added 'Vikram' has been given success by viewers.

22.title: MVA leaders should contact us for support in RS polls: Owaisi
22.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday said no one from the ruling Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government in Maharashtra has asked them for support in the upcoming elections to six Rajya Sabha seats. "If they want our support, they should contact us," Owaisi added. Meanwhile, Shiv Sena MLC Ambadas Danve said MVA leaders will soon decide on Owaisi's proposal.

23.title: Tripura CM Manik Saha holds door-to-door campaign ahead of bypolls
23.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha held a door-to-door campaign on Tuesday ahead of Assembly bypolls in the state. Saha, who replaced ex-CM Biplab Kumar Deb last month, is contesting bypolls from the Town Bardowali constituency and filed his nomination papers on June 6. Bypolls to Town Bardowali, Agartala, Surma and Jubarajnagar are scheduled to be held on June 23.

24.title: UK journalist & indigenous expert missing in Amazon rainforest
24.article_body: A British journalist and a Brazilian indigenous expert have gone missing while reporting in a remote area of the Amazon rainforest near Brazil's border with Peru. According to rights groups, Dom Phillips, a regular contributor to the Guardian newspaper, and Bruno Pereira had received threats before they went missing. Brazil's federal police and the Navy are searching for the duo.

25.title: 2 YouTube channels booked, blocked for inciting unrest in UP via fake news
25.article_body: A case has been registered against two YouTube channels for allegedly inciting communal agitation by streaming "misleading" news about the imposition of curfew and riots in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, officials said. The channels 'RA Knowledge World' and 'Bareilly Production' have also been blocked. "An attempt was made to disturb the communal situation of the city," a senior police officer said.

26.title: Pune reports 50% rise in COVID-19 cases in one week
26.article_body: Pune has reported a 50% rise in COVID-19 cases in the week from May 30 to June 5. The city saw 538 new infections during this period as compared to 357 cases between May 23 and May 29, as per the health department data. Mumbai, Pune and Thane have the maximum number of COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, it added.

27.title: 'Ardh' shows husband-wife relationship, struggle of common man: Rajpal
27.article_body: Actor Rajpal Yadav has spoken about his upcoming film 'Ardh', saying that it depicts the relationship of a husband and wife and their day-to-day struggle to live a normal life. He further said that the script showcases the struggle of a common man. "There are many people like (my character) Shiva who are struggling for their dreams," the actor added.

28.title: Mumbai's COVID-19 positivity rate exceeds pre-3rd wave figures
28.article_body: The current COVID-19 test positivity rate in Mumbai over the past week has exceeded five times that of December 2021, during the beginning of the third wave. Over the last week, 54,164 tests were conducted in Mumbai and 4,732 people tested positive, taking the positivity rate to 8.7%. Between December 21-27, last year, the positivity rate was recorded at 1.7%.

29.title: Meesho sends legal notice to marketing firm CEO over smear campaign: Report
29.article_body: E-commerce unicorn Meesho has sent a legal notice to the CEO of an influencer marketing company who was allegedly involved in a smear campaign against Meesho on social media, Moneycontrol reported. The cease and desist notice has asked the influencer marketing manager to reveal who he was working for. He has also been asked to take down all defamatory content.

30.title: Police arrest 28-yr-old tenant for robbing landlord's house in Hyderabad
30.article_body: The Nacharam Police along with Malkajgiri Central Crime Station team apprehended a 28-year-old man for allegedly carrying out robbery at his landlord's house in Hyderabad. Police also seized 53.9 tolas of gold ornaments, 166 grams of silver ornaments and cash worth ₹1,50,000. According to police, the accused committed the theft when the victim and her husband were away in Tirupati.

31.title: Man dies as tyre detached from truck hits him in Chennai; video surfaces
31.article_body: A man walking along a road was killed after a tyre detached from a truck hit him in Chennai, with video of the incident surfacing on social media. The incident took place when the man was walking towards his home after buying groceries. The police have detained the truck driver for questioning.

32.title: Anti-encroachment drive carried out on ₹65 cr-land in Greater Noida
32.article_body: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) on Monday carried out an anti-encroachment drive on land worth ₹65 crore, officials said. Five bulldozers were used during the drive, which went on for four hours. "People had constructed boundary walls in empty plots covering large portions...The identities of the colony residents are unknown," GNIDA public relations officer said.

33.title: Leopard rescued from well using 'charpai' in Pune; video surfaces
33.article_body: A video of a leopard being rescued from a 45-foot-deep well using a 'charpai' (woven bed) in a village in Pune's Junnar has surfaced online. The rescue operation was conducted by the Maharashtra Forest Department and non-profit Wildlife SOS after villagers found the leopard and informed them. The leopard was released after a few hours of observation, Wildlife SOS said.

34.title: Vidyut's 'Khuda Haafiz 2' gets postponed, will release on July 8
34.article_body: The release date of Vidyut Jammwal and Shivaleeka Oberoi-starrer 'Khuda Haafiz - Chapter II Agni Pariksha' has been postponed and will now release on July 8. Taking to Instagram, Vidyut announced the new release date for the film. The film was initially set to release on June 17. The film is a sequel to the 2020 film 'Khuda Haafiz'.

35.title: Monsoon to arrive in Mumbai by June 11, conditions favourable: IMD
35.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted June 11 as the date of the onset of monsoon in Mumbai and said the conditions have become favourable over the city. "We'll have to wait for it to enter south Konkan and Goa before it reaches Mumbai," an official said. Mumbai is likely to experience a good rainfall post mid-June, he added.

36.title: Finalise deal, fill potholes immediately: HC tells B'luru civic body
36.article_body: The Karnataka High Court on Monday ordered Bengaluru's civic body BBMP to finalise its contract with a private firm to fill the potholes across the city immediately. The court order came after BBMP agreed to pay ₹551 per square metre to the company to fix potholes. BBMP has been asked to submit a zone-wise status report within 10 days.

37.title: Panel of lawyers to assist Moosewala's family free of cost: DBA Mansa
37.article_body: The District Bar Association (DBA) of Punjab's Mansa on Tuesday said that a panel of lawyers will legally assist Sidhu Moosewala's family free of cost in his murder case. "We have also presented a resolution that no advocate will represent the accused in the case," DBA added. Moosewala was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Mansa on May 29.

38.title: Joe Root is England's best ever, now Sachin should watch out: Vaughan
38.article_body: Talking about Joe Root, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said, "Root is England's best ever - now Sachin Tendulkar should watch out." "He could surpass Sachin's record for the most Test runs," added Vaughan. Root recently became the joint-youngest batter to reach 10,000 runs in Tests, overtaking Sachin who reached the mark at the age of 31 years and 326 days.

39.title: Scared to go out for groceries; don't know if we'll be alive: Kashmiri Pandit
39.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit said that the members of the community are scared to go out of homes to buy groceries and medicines. "Offices are closed now...Our children have also stopped going to school because you never know what will happen," the Kashmiri Pandit said, adding, "We see a bleak future for our kids in Kashmir."

40.title: 'Borat...' actress Maria Bakalova to star in 'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3'
40.article_body: Maria Bakalova, known for her role in 'Borat Subsequent Moviefilm', is set to star in Marvel Studios' 'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3'. Confirming the news on her Instagram handle, the Oscar-nominated actress wrote, "Honestly...I'm the happiest most excited person ever!!!!" The James Gunn directorial, also starring Chris Pratt and Zoe Saldana, is scheduled to release in May 2023.

41.title: British woman raped in front of partner in Goa; accused arrested
41.article_body: A British woman visiting Goa was allegedly raped in front of her male partner at Sweet Water Lake near Arambol beach. The incident occurred on June 2. The accused, a 32-year-old local identified as Joel Vincent D'Souza, allegedly raped the middle-aged woman on the pretext of giving her a massage. D'Souza has been arrested, said police.

42.title: B'desh depot fire that killed 41 brought under control after 3 days
42.article_body: A fire that left 41 people dead at a container depot in Bangladesh's Chittagong has been brought under control after three days, an official said on Tuesday. "The fire hasn't been put out completely but there's no risk of further explosion," fire service official Monir Hossain told Reuters. Authorities suspect a container of hydrogen peroxide was the source of disaster.

43.title: India doesn’t need lecture from any nation on religious tolerance: Cong leader
43.article_body: Following ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Congress' Jaiveer Shergill said India doesn't need a lecture from any nation on religious tolerance. "BJP must realise that our secular identity shouldn't be dented for cheap political gains and TRP sensationalism...India's identity as vibrant, multi cultural habitat must stay forever!" Shergill tweeted.

44.title: There was no one to share the journey with for me back then: Jay Sean
44.article_body: Singer Jay Sean has stated that his journey in the music industry has been a "beautiful one" and added that he has accomplished "a lot" through the years. He added, "There just wasn't anyone to share the journey with for me back then...I often felt alone out there without a peer network or support system."

45.title: The craziest, weirdest blockbuster I've ever seen: Doctor Strange writer on RRR
45.article_body: American screenwriter C Robert Cargill, who penned Benedict Cumberbatch starrer film 'Doctor Strange', took to Twitter to praise SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'. "Friends came over last night to initiate me into the cult of RRR...and I'm here to report I'm now fully, truly, deeply a member," Cargill wrote, adding, "This is the craziest, most sincere, weirdest blockbuster I've ever seen."

46.title: I do see myself taking more playback singing opportunities: Aparshakti
46.article_body: Actor Aparshakti Khurana said he does see himself taking more playback singing opportunities in future, however, while having a "dedicated" acting career. "I'm still...new to music...I'm...three songs old...the love I have received for all three of the songs has been overwhelming, to say the least," he stated. "I love singing...as much as I move along and watch films," Aparshakti added.

47.title: Fintech startup Rupeek fires nearly 180 employees citing business reassessment
47.article_body: Bengaluru-based fintech startup Rupeek has fired 10-15% of its employees as the company reassess its business structure. While the firm didn’t mention the exact number of affected employees, it reportedly has a total of 1,200 employees and nearly 180 are estimated to have been fired. "Subdued macroeconomic environment...compelled us to re-calibrate our strategy, relook at our costs," Rupeek said.

48.title: As expected, SRK didn't even thank me for supporting Aryan: Shatrughan on drugs case
48.article_body: Talking about supporting Aryan Khan in drugs case, actor Shatrughan Sinha said, "As expected...I didn’t receive a thank you card from Shah Rukh Khan." He further said he was "maybe" the most prominent voice standing up for Aryan. "SRK should've gotten in touch with me. But, to be fair to him, he didn’t ask me for support either," Shatrughan stated.

49.title: List of achievements of PM Modi-led govt in 8 years shared by Harsh Goenka
49.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka shared a list of achievements of PM Narendra Modi-led government in eight years. The list showed how India climbed up in ranking in various fields such as automobile production, steel production, mobile phone production, and global innovation index. Goenka mentioned the source of the data as Bloomberg, MSCI, IMF and Kotak MF.

50.title: Sri Lanka needs $5 billion in 6 months for essentials: PM Wickremesinghe
50.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said the government will need at least $5 billion in the next six months to maintain basic standards of living, including some $3.3 billion for fuel imports. "Only establishing economic stability isn't enough, we have to restructure the entire economy," Wickremesinghe, who's preparing an interim budget to balance Sri Lanka's battered public finances, said.

51.title: Not important: Kerala Guv on Qatar's demand for apology over Prophet remarks
51.article_body: As Qatar sought the Indian government’s apology over former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said that "it is not important". "People are entitled to their opinions. How does it matter? That (demand for apology) is not important," Khan added. "India cannot bother about such small reactions," he stated.

52.title: Jaffer was my favourite player, placed him above other legends: Hardik
52.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya said former Team India opener Wasim Jaffer was his favourite cricketer while growing up. "I used to love watching him bat. [He was] someone I always placed...above other legends," added Hardik. "I used to copy his batting but I was never able to get his class," stated Hardik. Jaffer played 31 Tests for Team India.

53.title: Security cover provided to ex-BJP leader after rape threats over remarks on Prophet
53.article_body: The Delhi Police has provided security cover for former BJP leader Nupur Sharma and her family after she received rape and death threats over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad. The Delhi Police has also sent a notice to Twitter to join the investigation and help the police. The BJP on Sunday suspended Sharma over her controversial comments.

54.title: Didn't request ₹500 ticket cost, those making remarks about me lack logic: Nani
54.article_body: Ahead of release of his film 'Ante Sundaraniki', actor Nani said that he did not ask for a ticket price of ₹500 and that those making "disparaging" remarks about him due to ticket pricing "lack basic logic". "They mash up things...Somebody will say something...others will copy it...I simply stated...industry cannot survive on...pricing model of ₹20, 40 and 60," he added.

55.title: HDFC Bank hikes lending rate by 35 bps across all tenors from today, EMIs to go up
55.article_body: HDFC Bank has hiked its marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 35 basis points across all tenors, effective June 7. As a result of the hike, housing, vehicle and personal loans will become more expensive. The bank has hiked its MCLR by 60 basis points since the RBI hiked the repo rate by 40 basis points in May.

56.title: I'd planned a special preview of 'Toolsidas...' for dad & Rajiv Kapoor: Maker
56.article_body: Mridul Mahendra, director of 'Toolsidas Junior', has said that he had planned a special screening of the film for his father and actor Rajiv Kapoor. "Unfortunately, Rajiv sir left us in February last year and soon after that, even my father passed away," he added. Mridul further said 'Toolsidas Junior' depicts one of the most cherished parts of his life.

57.title: J&K Police fire at drone, recover 3 magnetic IEDs near Indo-Pak border
57.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police on Monday recovered three magnetic IEDs packed in children's tiffin boxes after firing at a drone in Kana Chak area near the India-Pakistan border. The incident occurred while a police party was deployed in the area after BSF also fired at a drone the same day. The IEDs' timers were set to different timings, police said.

58.title: Called me a w***e, said he will break my feet: Haaland on Milošević
58.article_body: Norwegian striker Erling Haaland alleged that Swedish defender Alexander Milošević called him a "w***e" and said he would break his feet, during the UEFA Nations League match between Norway and Sweden. Haaland added he scored a minute and a half after Milošević threatened to break his feet. Haaland scored a brace as Norway defeated Sweden 2-1. Milošević denied the allegations.

59.title: China says Australian aircraft threatened its sovereignty
59.article_body: China has accused an Australian military aircraft of seriously threatening its sovereignty and security. This comes after Australia said a Chinese aircraft flew dangerously close to one of its own during a routine surveillance activity in May. A Chinese government spokesperson said the countermeasures taken by the Chinese military were reasonable and lawful.

60.title: Kerala govt should take responsibility for lack of cleanliness in Kochi: Goyal
60.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said Kochi is lagging in cleanliness and state government along with local bodies should take responsibility for it. "I also love Kochi. But...I don't love it when in...short span of time it falls from fifth rank to 324 in the swachhta index," Goyal said. The minister is on a two-day visit to Kerala.

61.title: Things are different after pandemic: Sonu on 'Samrat...' collection
61.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood, speaking about the box office collection of 'Samrat Prithviraj', has said, "It might not have got as much business as expected." "But, we have to accept that things are a bit different after the pandemic," he added. Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj' has domestically earned around ₹44 crore since its release on June 3, as per trade estimates.

62.title: I'd finalised Akshay for 'Phool...', Ajay oozed confidence in audition: Director
62.article_body: Director Kuku Kohli revealed that he'd finalised Akshay Kumar as the lead actor for 'Phool Aur Kaante'. He added Akshay "couldn't allot bulk dates" as he'd started shooting for another film around the same time. "Then...I saw Ajay Devgn's picture in his dad's office...I auditioned [him]...and he oozed confidence," Kuku said. The film marked Ajay's debut in the film industry.

63.title: Will carry out suicide attack if Imran Khan harmed: Pak lawmaker
63.article_body: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party lawmaker Attaullah has threatened to target the country's current rulers and their children with a suicide attack if even "a single hair" on party Chairman and ex-PM Imran Khan's head is harmed. Thousands of more partymen are ready to carry out such attacks, Attaullah said. This comes amid reports that a conspiracy is afoot to assassinate Khan.

64.title: Just after my 3rd international match, Dhoni said I will be in World Cup team: Hardik
64.article_body: Hardik Pandya revealed that just after his third international match in 2016, MS Dhoni told him he'll be in India's T20 World Cup squad. "I didn't even bat...but he assured me that you've expressed yourself. It was...a dream come true," Hardik added. He stated he thought he wouldn't get to play after conceding 21 runs in his first international over.

65.title: Italy summons Russian envoy over media coverage criticism
65.article_body: Italy on Monday summoned the Russian ambassador to protest over allegations by Moscow that the Italian media were allegedly involved in an "anti-Russian campaign" amid the Ukraine-Russia war. "We reject [such] insinuations," Italy's Foreign Ministry said. "We [also] firmly reject accusations of amorality" levelled at certain Italian officials and journalists by Russian Foreign Ministry, it said.

66.title: Gerard Pique sent intimate messages to me, Shakira didn't deserve this: Brazilian model
66.article_body: Following Gerard Pique and Shakira's breakup, Brazilian model Suzy Cortez claimed that the footballer used to send her intimate messages on Instagram. She added that Pique used to ask her when she would return to Europe and also used to ask how much her butt measured. "Shakira didn't deserve this," the model further said.

67.title: RSS workers start 'chaddi' campaign after K'taka Congress' 'burn-the-chaddi' campaign
67.article_body: After Karnataka Congress leader Siddaramaiah asked party workers to start 'burn-the-chaddi' campaign, RSS workers launched a house-to-house collection drive for "chaddis" to send them to Congress leaders' homes. Congress students' wing NSUI were seen setting fire to a pair of khaki knickers, which are associated with RSS, in their protest against "saffronisation" of school textbooks.

68.title: 'Deadpool 3' is not going to be the Disney-fied Deadpool: Writer
68.article_body: 'Deadpool 3' writer Rhett Reese, speaking about the film being made under the banner of Disney, said, "These people [in Disney] do things their way." Reese added, "We were used to doing things our way...there are differences." However, he stated people in Marvel have been supportive. "They're gonna let Deadpool be Deadpool...this isn't going to be...Disney-fied Deadpool," he added.

69.title: Woman seeks bulletproof jacket for jailed gangster son, HC rejects plea
69.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court rejected a plea filed by the mother of an alleged gangster seeking a bulletproof jacket for him, both inside and outside the jail. Her son is presently lodged in Delhi's Tihar Jail. "This court would refrain from passing any directions...since the petitioner's son is lodged in a jail beyond this court's jurisdiction," HC said.

70.title: Lot of people in Indian setup feel Rahul isn't a natural leader: Pollock
70.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain Shaun Pollock said a "lot" of people in the Indian setup have said that batter KL Rahul is "not" a natural leader. Pollock added that Rahul is also considered a "reluctant" captain by them. Rahul will lead India in the upcoming five-match T20I series against South Africa. Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli have been rested for the series.

71.title: China asks international community to stop sending arms to Ukraine
71.article_body: Chinese envoy to the UN Dai Bing on Monday asked the international community to stop sending weapons to Ukraine. He said that constantly providing weapons or imposing sanctions against Russia will not solve the problem but will expand the conflict. "China once again calls on the parties concerned to put international and regional peace and security first," he added.

72.title: Take action against those spreading hate: Vijayan on remarks against Prophet
72.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday urged the Centre to take action against those "propagating hate and trying to destroy the secular fabric of our country." "Sangh Parivar forces have brought our country...to a state of embarrassment in front of the world," he added. Vijayan's remarks came after several countries condemned ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

73.title: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi meets Sidhu Moosewala's family
73.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday met the family of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead on May 29, at his village Moosa. Moosewala joined Congress in December 2021 and contested the 2022 Punjab Assembly elections from the Mansa constituency. "Deeply shocked...by the murder of promising Congress leader and talented artist, Sidhu Moosewala," Gandhi had tweeted earlier.

74.title: 16-yr-old girl killed, another hurt after car hits bicycle in Delhi
74.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was killed and another girl was seriously injured after an alleged speeding car hit a bicycle they were riding near Kanjhawala in Delhi on Monday. The car driver, who drove away after the accident, was arrested, police said. "The...girls were rushed to a nearby hospital, where one of them was declared dead on arrival," DCP (Rohini) said.

75.title: 2 women steal jewellery under pretext of shopping in Pune; arrested
75.article_body: Pune's Dattawadi police have arrested two women, aged 29 and 31, for allegedly stealing jewellery under the pretext of shopping and also seized a mangalsutra from the accused. One of the accused has 22 cases filed against her for stealing under the guise of buying bullion. The police set a trap and caught the duo on the Pune-Satara road.

76.title: Ananya to star opposite Akshay in C Sankaran Nair's biopic: Report
76.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday will reportedly play a lawyer alongside actor Akshay Kumar in C Sankaran Nair's biopic. A report by Mid Day stated Akshay will play the role of a late lawyer-activist. The film will reportedly be based on Raghu and Pushpa Palat's book 'The Case That Shook the Empire'. The film will be directed by Karan Singh Tyagi.

77.title: Done to please foreign leaders: Owaisi on suspension of BJP leaders
77.article_body: Following BJP's move to suspend Nupur Sharma and Naveen Kumar Jindal, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said it was done to "please leaders of foreign countries". "This issue had become big in the Gulf countries, so under compulsion, PM of the country took action against his national spokesperson," Owaisi added. "You want to please the leaders of foreign countries," he stated.

78.title: Struggled a lot for 'Main...', SRK made me wait for 3 years: Farah
78.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan said she "struggled a lot" to direct her first film which was the 2004 Shah Rukh Khan starrer 'Main Hoon Na'. "Shah Rukh...made me work for it and he made me wait for three years," added Farah. "I'd ask myself, 'Why am I not making a film?'. I'd wake up with angst in my heart," stated Farah.

79.title: Heatwave warning for Delhi, IMD asks people to 'venture out carefully'
79.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has a heatwave warning for Delhi. "Severe heatwave from June 4 in Haryana, Punjab, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh and parts of Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan. Temperature varying between 44°C-47°C. Shall continue for four more days," an IMD scientist said, adding that people should venture out carefully as the heat spell is very severe.

80.title: Extremely serious matter, will help you: Varun Dhawan to fan alleging abuse by her father
80.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan vowed to help a female fan after she alleged domestic abuse by her father. The fan tweeted that her father abuses her and her mother "every single day". She added the authorities haven't taken a strict action against him. Calling it an "extremely serious matter", Varun wrote, "If this is true...I'll help...you and speak to the authorities."

81.title: Madhavan shares throwback pic with wife on wedding anniversary, pens note
81.article_body: Actor R Madhavan wrote a note for his wife Sarita Birje as the couple celebrated their 23rd wedding anniversary on Monday. Sharing a throwback picture with his wife on his Instagram Stories, Madhavan wrote, "How is it that I am more in love with you now than ever before and I am just getting started...Happy anniversary wifey."

82.title: Was born with a crooked neck, people called me ugly: Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta
82.article_body: Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta spoke to 'Humans of Bombay' about her life before becoming one of the youngest CEOs in India at the age of 33. "I was born with a crooked neck…people always told me how ugly I looked," she said. She added that at the age of 22, she had suicidal thoughts after facing multiple job rejections.

83.title: I have no hand in this matter: Gangster Bishnoi on threat letter to Salman Khan
83.article_body: Delhi Police has questioned jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi in connection with the threat letter to actor Salman Khan. Bishnoi told police that he has no hand in this matter and does not know who issued the letter. The threat letter received by actor Salman and his father Salim Khan allegedly stated, "Tumhara Moosewala kar denge (you'll end up like Moosewala)."

84.title: Fire breaks out at bank in Supreme Court, no casualties reported
84.article_body: A minor fire broke out at a UCO Bank branch inside the Supreme Court premises on Tuesday and no casualties were reported. It was brought under control by 10.05 am by five tenders, Delhi Fire Services said. The fire spread to the false ceiling, air conditioning unit and office files in the records room of the bank, officials added.

85.title: How much will the new Apple MacBooks cost in India?
85.article_body: Apple has announced new MacBook Air and MacBook Pro with M2 chip. While they will be available in India next month, MacBook Air with M2 will start at ₹1,19,900 and the 512GB storage option for the MacBook Air will cost ₹1,49,900. The 13-inch MacBook Pro with M2 chip will start at ₹1,29,900 and the 512GB MacBook Pro will cost ₹1,49,900.

86.title: Former Sony CEO Nobuyuki Idei dies of liver failure at 84
86.article_body: Former Sony CEO Nobuyuki Idei died of liver failure on June 2, aged 84, the company said. Idei joined the company in 1960 and served as CEO from 1998 to 2005. He held leadership roles in Sony's audio, home video and creative communication divisions. Idei stepped down in 2005 to take responsibility for slumping earnings.

87.title: PM to lay foundation stone for B'luru Suburban Rail project on June 20
87.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will lay the foundation stone for the Bengaluru Suburban Rail project on June 20, said Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday. According to the latest blueprint, the project will span a rail network of 148.17 km, with 57 stations planned across four corridors in six directions of Bengaluru. The project is expected to be completed by 2026.

88.title: Bengal man chops off wife's hand after she gets job as govt nurse
88.article_body: A man and his two accomplices allegedly chopped off his wife's hand in West Bengal's Purba Bardhaman after she got a job as a nurse at a government hospital. A case has been registered in the matter. "The accused...put a pillow on [woman's] face to muffle her screams and then chopped off her...hand," an official said citing the complaint.

89.title: Priyanka shares pic with Anne Hathaway, BLACKPINK's Lisa; fans react
89.article_body: Priyanka Chopra took to Instagram to share a picture with Anne Hathaway and BLACKPINK singer Lisa from an event in Paris. "And then there was us...girls just wanna have fun," Priyanka wrote. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "Three of...best ladies in...world have come together!" Another fan wrote, "Anne, Pri and Lalisa in one frame!!!!!!!!!! I'm not...dreaming, am I?"

90.title: Ukrainian women, girls facing sexual violence, trafficking: UN
90.article_body: Ukrainians, especially women and girls, are being subjected to sexual violence in the war-torn country, which is turning into "a human trafficking crisis", said Pramila Patten, the UN special envoy for sexual violence in conflict. She said the UN human rights office received 124 complaints of conflict-related sexual violence, out of which 97 involved women and girls.

91.title: Wife, son stab Punjab man 15 times, kill him for demanding money; FIR filed
91.article_body: A 49-year-old man, Kulwinder Singh, died after he was allegedly stabbed 15 times by his wife and son. Reports said his wife, Satnam Kaur, told police he was an alcoholic who hurt himself after collapsing in "drunken state". However, stab wounds were found on Singh's body, after which, his son admitted to stabbing him for demanding money to purchase alcohol.

92.title: Sena MLAs moved to unknown hotel ahead of Rajya Sabha polls on June 10
92.article_body: Shiv Sena has moved a group of its MLAs and some independent candidates to an unknown hotel ahead of the Maharashtra Rajya Sabha polls for six seats. The move is a preventive measure to dismiss any possibility of horse-trading by the BJP ahead of the polls. Sena has nominated Sanjay Raut and Sanjay Pawar for the Rajya Sabha polls.

93.title: Zomato likely to sign Blinkit's acquisition deal on June 17: Reports
93.article_body: The Zomato board is likely to meet on June 17 to sign off Blinkit's acquisition, as per reports. While the deal earlier valued Blinkit at $700 million, the final value is expected to be lower as this would involve a stock swap in a 1:10 ratio, where Zomato would get 10 shares of Blinkit for every one of its shares.

94.title: My dream role is Kangana's character in 'Queen': Akansha Ranjan Kapoor
94.article_body: Akansha Ranjan Kapoor, speaking about her dream role, said, "It has always been Kangana Ranaut's character in the film 'Queen'." She further stated, "I love that [Kangana's] character. But I remember before 'Guilty', I wanted to play something like that. So it keeps changing." Akansha made her debut in the 2020 film 'Guilty'.

95.title: Kashmiri Pandits had to migrate twice when BJP was in power: Kejriwal
95.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has criticised BJP over targeted killings of Kashmiri Pandits in Jammu and Kashmir, claiming, "In the last 30 years, Kashmiri Pandits had to migrate twice and both happened when BJP was in power." He called the killings a "massacre". Last week, Kashmiri Pandits held protests and threatened mass migration over targeted killings in the valley.

96.title: BJP govt made 'mockery of plight of unemployed Goans': AAP leader
96.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party leaders have criticised BJP-led Goa government for backtracking on its promise of employing youths in government jobs. Goa AAP Vice-President Surel Tilve alleged the government has made a "mockery of the plight of unemployed Goans". This came after CM Sawant reportedly said that the government is in a position to employ only about 8,000-10,000 more people.

97.title: Digital lending platform FlexiLoans raises $90 million
97.article_body: Digital lending platform FlexiLoans has raised $90 million in a mix of equity and debt from Denmark-based Maj Invest and UK-based fintech investor Fasanara Capital. The investment will mark Fasanara's first transaction in India's technology space. The family office of Sanjay Nayar, Hong Kong-based Banga family and Alliance Tire Group Founder Yogesh Mahansaria also participated in the round.

98.title: Whenever we need them to score runs, they all get out: Kapil Dev on Rohit, Kohli, Rahul
98.article_body: Ex-India captain Kapil Dev criticised the approach of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul in shortest format of the game. "All of these are players who can hit at...strike rate of 150-160. Whenever we need them to score runs...they all get out," Kapil said. He added, "The approach needs to change. And if it doesn't...you've to change the players."

99.title: China will lose 40% of people every generation at current birth rates: Musk
99.article_body:
The world’s richest person Elon Musk on Monday tweeted about a possible "population collapse" while sharing an article about China’s birth rate. Musk wrote, "Most people still think China has a one-child policy. China had its lowest birthdate ever last year, despite having a three-child policy!
At current birth rates, China will lose approximately 40% of people every generation!"

100.title: Warne said I wasn't needed, later said 'you're my man': Ex-RR pacer Tanveer
100.article_body: Sharing his experience while representing RR in IPL 2008 with the team led by Shane Warne, Pakistani pacer Sohail Tanveer said he was initially informed that Warne "didn't" need him. "I bowled well and picked up 2/26 [in a match]. After that...Warne came to me and said '[you're] my man'," added Tanvir. Tanvir won the purple cap in IPL 2008.

101.title: Prince Harry & Meghan share photo of Lilibet on her first birthday
101.article_body: UK's Prince Harry and wife Meghan Markle on Monday shared a picture of their daughter Lilibet celebrating her first birthday at a backyard picnic over the weekend. Lilibet Diana Mountbatten-Windsor was born in California and was named in honour of Queen Elizabeth II, whose family nickname has been Lilibet since she was a toddler. Lilibet is the Queen's 11th great-grandchild.

102.title: Mother jailed after 2-year-old son shoots father dead in US
102.article_body: A 28-year-old woman was jailed and is facing criminal charges after her two-year-old son shot his father dead in the US. The gun was not properly stored and was easily accessible even to a two-year-old, said Orange County Sheriff John Mina. "A young child has to live his life knowing he shot his father," Mina added.

103.title: Maldives welcomes BJP's action against Nupur Sharma over remarks on Prophet
103.article_body: The Maldives government has said it is "deeply concerned by the derogatory remarks made by some officials of BJP" on Prophet Muhammad. Maldives welcomed the "denouncement" by the Indian government of the remarks and the "prompt action taken by BJP against those officials".  BJP had suspended Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal over the remarks.

104.title: Candle flares bright before burning out: J&K LG on targeted killings
104.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha said religious leaders and the people of Kashmir are condemning the targeted killings of civilians in the Valley. "When a candle is about to burn out, its flame flares bright. This (militancy) is taking its last gasps," Sinha added. "They are unable to digest the arrival of so many tourists to the Valley," he stated.

105.title: Will respond swiftly & forcefully if N Korea holds nuclear test: US
105.article_body: US Deputy State Secretary Wendy Sherman said any nuclear test by North Korea would be "in complete violation of UN Security Council resolutions [and] there would be a swift and forceful response to such a test".  "I believe that not only South Korea...US and Japan but the entire world will respond in a strong and clear manner," she added.

106.title: Top Indian woman cyclist accuses coach of 'inappropriate behaviour' in Slovenia
106.article_body: A top Indian woman cyclist has accused the national sprint team chief coach R K Sharma of "inappropriate behaviour" during a camp in Slovenia, according to officials. The complainant was "immediately" brought back to India "to ensure her safety", Sports Authority of India said in a statement. Two separate inquiry committees have been formed to look into the allegation.

107.title: Ram Charan, wife Upasana celebrate driver's b'day, pics surface
107.article_body: 'RRR' actor Ram Charan celebrated his driver Naresh's birthday on Sunday, pictures of which have surfaced on social media. In the pictures, Charan and his wife Upasana Kamineni can be seen standing with Naresh, who was seen cutting the birthday cake. Charan is currently shooting for a film with director Shankar, which is tentatively titled 'RC15'.

108.title: Rajasthan BJP MLAs shifted to resort ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
108.article_body: The BJP shifted most of its MLAs in Rajasthan to a resort in the outskirts of Jaipur. This comes ahead of Rajya Sabha elections for four seats from the state, scheduled for June 10. Calling it a training camp, a party spokesperson said that the MLAs will be given training on the Rajya Sabha elections.

109.title: Muhammad Asif made me look like a very ordinary pacer: Shoaib Akhtar
109.article_body: Recalling the India-Pakistan 2006 Karachi Test, ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said, "The way [Muhammad] Asif trapped the Indian team...I have never seen [such] a magician. He made me look like a very ordinary [pacer]." Akhtar added Asif dismissed VVS Laxman in the exact same manner in both innings. Akhtar stated he was trying to "hurt" Sachin Tendulkar in the Test.

110.title: Delhi govt to open 100 more mohalla clinics across the city
110.article_body: At least 100 more Aam Aadmi Mohalla Clinics will be opened across the city, the Delhi government on Monday said. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia met with officials to review the progress of the project. The government will soon completely digitise the clinics and doctors will be able to track the medical history of patients to provide better treatment, Sisodia added.

111.title: Making law for population control won't serve any purpose: Bihar CM
111.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said making a law for population control won't serve any purpose. "Population control can only be achieved by educating women and girls. The fertility rate can be checked only through education and awareness," Kumar added. He cited China's instance where one-child policy was in effect for many years. "It has now changed...to two-child policy," Kumar stated.

112.title: Indian-origin Gupta brothers arrested in UAE over corruption charges
112.article_body: The South African government on Monday said two Indian-origin businessmen have been arrested in the UAE while accusing them of profiting from their close links with former President Jacob Zuma and exerting unfair influence. The brothers, Atul and Rajesh Gupta, have denied any wrongdoing. Meanwhile, South African officials said that their extradition talks are taking place with the UAE.

113.title: Bear kills MP couple; drags them to nullah, feeds on body parts for 4 hrs
113.article_body: A couple was killed by a bear in Madhya Pradesh on Sunday morning when the two were returning from a temple near their house. The victims reportedly died while trying to save each other from the bear. Eyewitnesses reportedly told police that the bear dragged them to a nullah and fed on their body parts for four hours.

114.title: Admissions closing soon for IIM-I & Jigsaw’s Business Analytics Program
114.article_body: After 12 batches, IIM Indore's online Business Analytics Program will begin its 13th cohort soon. 83% of learners enrolled in this 10-month program have transitioned in their careers, Jigsaw revealed. The program offers 5D framework-based curriculum, BYOP feature and Kaggle's In-Class competitions & modules in technologies like Big Data, Data Visualization & ML to help learners grasp the concepts.

115.title: Was asked for extra ticket for 'Dil...' in theatre, said 'I'm director': Ananth
115.article_body: Actor Ananth Narayan Mahadevan, who directed 'Dil Vil Pyar Vyar', said that he went to theatre to see reaction of the audience. "I had...the joy of someone coming and asking me, 'Do you have an extra ticket?' I told him, 'I don't need a ticket...I'm the director'. He got excited and said, 'Then you can get me tickets'," he added.

116.title: Ex-India cricketer Naman Ojha's father arrested in MP for cheating bank of ₹1.25 crore
116.article_body: VK Ojha, father of ex-India cricketer Naman Ojha, was arrested by police in MP's Betul district for allegedly cheating bank of ₹1.25 crore. Around 34 fake accounts were opened and KCC loan was transferred to accounts and a sum of ₹1.25 crore was withdrawn when VK Ojha was posted as manager of Bank of Maharashtra branch in 2013, police said.

117.title: India in talks to increase discounted Russian oil imports from Rosneft: Report
117.article_body: India is in talks to increase its Russian oil imports with state-owned Rosneft PJSC amid Western sanctions on Moscow over the Ukraine war, as per a report. It added that work is on to finalise a six-month supply contract for discounted Russian crude oil to India and that details on volumes and pricing are still being negotiated.

118.title: Fuel pump shut for selling petrol in bottles before Kanpur clashes
118.article_body: A fuel pump's licence was suspended after it was seen selling petrol in bottles, which is prohibited, in CCTV footage in Kanpur, said a district official. This comes amid violent clashes in the city over suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. A police officer said since petrol bombs were used, they tried to find the source.

119.title: Johnny Depp spends around $62,000 at Indian restaurant in UK to celebrate trial win
119.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp spent more than $62,000 for a special celebratory dinner with his friends at Indian restaurant 'Varanasi' in Birmingham  on Sunday to celebrate his defamation trial victory against his ex-wife Amber Heard. "The most talked about person on the planet right now joined us for dinner last night!" the restaurant wrote on Instagram, while sharing pictures.

120.title: Bomb threat issued to Lucknow, Unnao RSS offices; case registered
120.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police registered a case after a bomb threat to blow up Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) offices in Lucknow and Unnao was received on WhatsApp on Monday. An FIR was registered at Madiyaon Police Station in connection with the threat, police added. "With cyber cell's help, the number that sent the message will be traced," Lucknow Police said.

121.title: Dominican Republic Environment Min shot dead by friend in his office
121.article_body: The Dominican Republic's Environment Minister, Orlando Jorge Mera, was shot dead on Monday in his office by a close friend, the government said. Mera, son of former President Salvador Blanco, was shot by businessman Miguel Cruz, who was arrested at a church after telling a priest he committed a crime and handed over a gun to him, authorities said.

122.title: Sign naming road after Godse comes up in K'taka's Udupi; removed
122.article_body: Local officials and police have removed a signboard naming a road after Nathuram Godse, who had assassinated Mahatma Gandhi, in a village in Karnataka's Udupi following criticism. A panchayat officer said that no resolution had been passed for naming the road after Godse and a police complaint has been filed. Pictures and videos of the signboard had gone viral.

123.title: India reports 3,714 new COVID-19 cases, 2,513 recoveries in last 24 hours
123.article_body: India has reported 3,714 COVID-19 cases, 2,513 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,518 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 26,976, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,708, according to the latest data.

124.title: Viral video shows teacher sleeping in classroom as student blows fan in Bihar
124.article_body: A video showing a teacher sleeping in a classroom in Bihar's Bettiah has gone viral on social media. In the video, a student can be seen blowing a fan while the teacher is fast asleep. Reacting to the video, social media users wrote, "Bihar model of education," and "Welcome to Bihar."

125.title: I don't think I've made it in B'wood, have a lot to prove: Ahan Shetty
125.article_body: Actor Ahan Shetty, who made his Bollywood debut in 2021 with the film 'Tadap', said, "I don't think I've made it in the industry...I have a lot to prove." Ahan won the IIFA 2022 award for Best Debut Actor (Male) for his performance in 'Tadap'. "It's...special for me. I want to continue to work hard...continue to prove myself," he stated.

126.title: Christianity being spread across Punjab to weaken Sikhs: Akal Takht Jathedar
126.article_body: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Monday said Christianity is being spread across villages of Punjab to weaken Sikhs. "Sikhs are facing a lot of difficulties that are making us weak religiously, socially and economically," he added. "I appeal to all Sikhs, especially those in border areas to spread and strengthen Sikhism," Singh stated.

127.title: Man trying to sell leopard skin worth ₹10 lakh arrested in Bengaluru
127.article_body: A 30-year-old man, who was planning to sell leopard skin worth ₹10 lakh, was arrested in Bengaluru on Monday. Acting on a tip-off, a police team posing as customers, approached the accused, identified as Dhanraj, and arrested him. The police also seized ganja worth ₹8,000 from him. According to police, Dhanraj has several criminal cases pending against him.

128.title: An error, statement made under provocation: Jethmalani on Nupur’s remarks
128.article_body: Reacting to former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Rajya Sabha MP Mahesh Jethmalani said it was an "insensitive statement made under provocation", which she has regretted. "The real fringe are those who on public platforms stoke fire created by her error and ruin GoI's efforts to repair the damage and restore India's image abroad," he tweeted.

129.title: Car parking lift collapses in 23-storey building near Mumbai, 4 injured
129.article_body: Four people were injured after a car parking lift collapsed in a 23-storey building in Kalyan, near Mumbai. Reports said that the incident took place when repair work was being done and the lift was being tested. Police said that the building has a four-storey car parking facility and that the cause of the collapse will be checked.

130.title: BMTC to run 10 buses from newly-opened Visvesvaraya rail terminal
130.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has decided to operate 10 buses from the newly-opened Sir M Visvesvaraya terminal at the Byappanahalli railway station. The buses will make 144 trips a day, connecting the Visvesvaraya terminal to Channasandra, Central Silk Board, Banaswadi, Subbaiahnapalya, Nagawara and Munnekolalu Cross, said BMTC in a statement.

131.title: Staffer peeps at woman taking a bath at hospital in Pune; booked
131.article_body: Pune police have booked a 25-year-old staffer who works at a hospital in the city on charges of voyeurism and stalking after he allegedly peeped at a woman who was taking a bath there. The woman, who is a relative of a patient, approached hospital authorities and police but the suspect had fled by then, according to a police official.

132.title: 2 more minors raped in Hyderabad, number rises to 5 in a week
132.article_body: Two more rape cases involving minors were reported in Hyderabad on Monday, taking the total to five in a week. In the first case, a 17-year-old girl was lured and raped by a 23-year-old man, whereas in another case, the victim was sexually assaulted at a movie theatre. The accused in both the cases have been arrested, police said.

133.title: Auto driver molests 17-yr-old girl, bites her after she resists in Pune
133.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver allegedly molested a 17-year-old girl and bit her when she resisted in Pune, police said. She had taken the auto to go home but the driver took her to a secluded place, allegedly hugged her forcibly and also touched her inappropriately, police added. Two passers-by heard the girl screaming for help and rushed towards her, police stated.

134.title: Man in drunk state drowns during pool party in Gurugram; 4 booked
134.article_body: A 33-year-old man from Delhi allegedly drowned in a swimming pool in an inebriated state during a party in a village in Gurugram, police said on Monday. Three of the deceased's friends and the pool owner were booked for negligence causing death, ACP (DLF) Sanjeev Kumar said. The deceased's brother claimed that the man's friends had assaulted and killed him.

135.title: Bombay HC ends POCSO case as victim, now 18+, & accused decide to marry
135.article_body: Bombay High Court has quashed FIR under Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act for penetrative sexual assault, after victim, who is now reportedly above 18 years of age, said she and the accused were in love and are now to be married. The bench noted if prosecution still remains, it will come in way of their peaceful life.

136.title: Ex-Punjab Minister and Cong leader Sadhu Singh Dharamsot held in corruption case
136.article_body: Punjab's former Forest Minister and Congress leader, Sadhu Singh Dharamsot, was arrested by Vigilance Bureau (VB) in a corruption case. A local journalist who was allegedly working as an aide was also arrested. This comes after VB arrested Mohali Divisional Forest Officer over graft charges. He disclosed to VB how Dharamsot used to be bribed before cutting a single tree.

137.title: Expected critics to rip 'Om...' apart, glowing reviews shocked me: Farah
137.article_body: Talking about her 2007 film 'Om Shanti Om' starring Shah Rukh Khan, director Farah Khan said, "I was prepared for the fact that the critics would rip it apart as it was crazier than 'Main Hoon Na'." "We showed Shah Rukh fighting with a stuffed tiger and what not!...I was...[shocked] that it got such glowing reviews," added Farah.

138.title: Steve Harvey confirms daughter Lori Harvey and Michael B Jordan's breakup
138.article_body: American TV host Steve Harvey confirmed his daughter Lori Harvey and actor Michael B Jordan's breakup. "I still gotta go to work...I still gotta take care of my family. I'm team Lori...1000%," he said. Steve added, "[Michael] is still a cool guy...from what I know. It's a breakup. I'm pretty sure they'll be fine. People break up all the time."

139.title: Bengaluru makes masks must in public places amid COVID-19 spike
139.article_body: Bengaluru's municipal body BBMP on Monday made wearing masks mandatory in public places. This comes amid a spike in COVID-19 cases. "Everyday, more than 200 new COVID-19 cases are being reported and we are conducting 16,000 tests," said BBMP official Dr Harish Kumar. The number of daily tests by BBMP will be increased to 20,000, he added.

140.title: Don't call us pro-China, we're pro-US: Taiwan's opposition party
140.article_body: Taiwan's main opposition party chief Eric Chu said it's wrong to label the Kuomintang (KMT) party as being pro-China as it has always been pro-US. However, he added that the party is also dedicated to defending the island by talking to Beijing. KMT party ruled China until fleeing to Taiwan in 1949 after losing a civil war to the Communists.

141.title: Saudi man offers to marry Amber Heard after she loses defamation case against Johnny Depp
141.article_body: A man from Saudi Arabia has offered to marry actress Amber Heard after she lost a defamation case against her ex-husband Johnny Depp. "Amber...since all doors are closing on you, you have no one except me to take care of you," the man said in a voice note circulating online. "I am better than that old man," he added.

142.title: I started diverting all my endorsements to charity work: Sonu Sood
142.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood revealed that he started diverting all the endorsements he did to charity work and education. "With steel brands, I started making houses, with light brands I started lighting villages...and when I did mobile brands, I started donating mobiles," he stated. "I'm educating thousands of kids in tie-up with universities, I did free endorsements for them," he added.

143.title: 17-yr-old boy found dead with stab injury in abdomen in Delhi
143.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was found dead with a stab injury in his abdomen on HR road near Ramjas School in Delhi's Anand Parbat area on Monday, police said. "We got a call at 7.15 am...regarding an unknown person lying dead on HR road," DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan said. "No eyewitness was found... [but] a case of murder has been registered," she added.

144.title: US rapper Trouble shot dead at female friend's apartment
144.article_body: US rapper Trouble, who collaborated with Drake and The Weeknd in his career, was shot dead at a female friend's apartment in Georgia. The police have issued an arrest warrant for 33-year-old Jamichael Jones. Police said Jones and Trouble were not known to each other, but that Jones was involved in a "domestic situation" with the woman Trouble was visiting.

145.title: ED files 1st charge sheet against Choksi's wife, calls her 'ultimate beneficiary'
145.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has filed its first charge sheet against fugitive Mehul Choksi's wife Priti Choksi in the ₹13,000 crore PNB fraud case, stating that she was "hand in glove with her husband" and was the "ultimate beneficial owner". Called "abettor of the crime", the fresh money laundering charges against Priti will allow agencies to pursue her extradition from Antigua.

146.title: UK PM Boris Johnson wins no-confidence vote
146.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has won the no-confidence motion brought in the country's Parliament over the 'partygate' scandal. Johnson got 211 lawmakers' support while 148 MPs of his Conservative Party voted against him. The vote was triggered after at least 54 MPs from Conservative Party submitted letters of no confidence to the Chair of the 1922 Committee of backbench lawmakers.

147.title: Apple introduces macOS Ventura with new tools & updates on Safari
147.article_body: Apple has previewed macOS Ventura desktop operating system with several new tools, like the Stage Manager, which lets users group windows and switch quickly between apps. Safari has added the Shared Tabs Group feature which will let users share a set of open tabs with their friends. Safari has also been enabled to use the more secure FIDO Alliance-supported passkeys.

148.title: Apple announces new MacBooks with M2 chip starting from $1,199
148.article_body: Apple has announced new MacBook Air and MacBook Pro with the M2 chip, which will include 25% more transistors and 50% more bandwidth than the M1. Apple said it's focused on power-efficient performance, maximising speed performance while limiting the amount of power needed to do so. MacBook Air with M2 starts at $1,199, while the MacBook Pro starts at $1,299.

149.title: Apple iOS16 adds 'Safety Check' feature to help people in abusive relationships
149.article_body: Apple's iOS16 unveiled on Monday will have a new feature called 'Safety Check' to help people in abusive relationships by revoking shared device access with their partners. It will stop location sharing, reset privacy settings and protect messages from the abusive partner. Apple unveiled updates to the 'My Home' app and a new protocol for smart home devices called 'Matter'.

150.title: Apple unveils iOS 16 with updated Lock Screen, adds 'Undo' feature for sent Messages
150.article_body: Apple on Monday unveiled iOS 16, which includes an updated Lock Screen that can be completely customised with widgets. The Lock Screen will also get a new 'Live screen' activity feature. The new iOS has also upgraded Messages app that will let users undo sent messages or edit messages after sending them.

151.title: Have a great year ahead: Tendulkar to Rahane on his 34th birthday
151.article_body: Taking to Twitter to wish India batter Ajinkya Rahane on his 34th birthday, Sachin Tendulkar wrote, "Wishing you a very happy birthday Ajinkya. Have a great year ahead." Rahane, who made his debut for India in August 2011, has so far scored 8,268 runs across all international formats. Rahane last played in a Test against South Africa in January 2022.

152.title: Who is Radhika Merchant, Mukesh & Nita Ambani's son Anant's fiancee?
152.article_body: Mukesh and Nita Ambani on Sunday hosted an Arangetram event for Radhika Merchant, who is engaged to their son Anant Ambani. She is the daughter of billionaire Viren Merchant, the CEO of the pharma company Encore Healthcare. She studied politics and economics during her undergraduate from New York University and completed her Bharatanatyam training under Guru Bhavana Thakar.

153.title: This happens in our industry: Kuku on extra-marital affair with Aruna
153.article_body: Director-producer Sandeep Kohli, known as Kuku Kohli, has spoken about his extra-marital affair with veteran actress Aruna Irani, saying that such things happen in the industry. He added that the two live together. On being asked if his daughters have accepted the veteran actress as family, he said, "Aisa kabhi mauka hi nahi aaya (The opportunity never came up only)."

154.title: It's like he came to say goodbye: Gulzar on KK's last recorded song
154.article_body: After late singer KK's last recorded song 'Dhoop Paani Bahne De' was released, veteran lyricist Gulzar said, "It's like he came to say goodbye." Gulzar further said, "When he came to sing the song for 'Sherdil', it filled my heart with joy. It's a shame that this had to go down as one of his last songs."

155.title: Been tough 2 weeks but also exhilarating: Nadal on 14th French Open win
155.article_body: Reflecting on the past two weeks in Paris following his record-extending 14th French Open title, world number four Rafael Nadal said it has been "tough", but it's also been very "exhilarating". He added, "Very pleased, obviously. I'm happy...And I'll be leaving here with an unforgettable memory." Overall, it was Nadal's 22nd Grand Slam title win on Sunday.

156.title: Russian authorities put investigative journalist on wanted list
156.article_body: Investigative journalist Andrei Soldatov on Monday said that Russian authorities had placed him on a wanted list and frozen his bank accounts. Soldatov is known for his coverage of Russian security agencies. Soldatov claimed the case against him had been filed in a manner similar to that of two journalists accused of spreading "fake information" about Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

157.title: I'm silent, not sick: Dharmendra in video refuting hospitalisation rumours
157.article_body: Actor Dharmendra shared a video denying rumours of him being hospitalised in a 'critical' condition as was reported earlier. "Main chup hu, lekin beemaar nahi (I'm silent but not sick)," said the 86-year-old veteran actor. "Be positive, think positive, life will be positive," said Dharmendra in the video. He was hospitalised last month following a muscle spasm.

158.title: Man kills wife, daughters aged 2 & 3 with stone in Rajasthan
158.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly killed his wife and two daughters, aged two and three years, by hitting them with a heavy stone after a domestic issue at a village in Rajasthan's Udaipur district. The man then ran away, police said. The couple's eight-year-old son was also present on the spot and he rushed to his grandparents' house to inform them.

159.title: I had to do Deepika's 'Bajirao Mastani' scene in audition: Manushi
159.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar has said that she was given a scene from actress Deepika Padukone's 2015 film 'Bajirao Mastani' for her audition. She called the audition "most intense and challenging", adding that the call after the audition confirming her role was validation that she could chase her dreams in Bollywood. Manushi made her Bollywood debut in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj'.

160.title: NATO kicks off drills with Finland, Sweden amid tensions with Russia
160.article_body: NATO on Sunday kicked off a two-week military exercise with Finland and Sweden in the Baltic Sea amid tensions with Russia over the war in Ukraine. Notably, Finland and Sweden had applied to join NATO in May. Russia had warned the two countries against joining the Western military alliance and warned them of retaliatory measures against the move.

161.title: Happy to see how my nephew Nadal is totally normal guy despite success: Toni
161.article_body: Praising nephew Rafael Nadal, his uncle and ex-coach Toni Nadal said he's happy to see how the 36-year-old is a "totally normal guy", who plays good tennis and hasn't changed despite having a successful career. Nadal recently won his 22nd Grand Slam title, an all-time men's record, at French Open. Toni is currently part of Canadian Felix Auger-Aliassime's coaching team.

162.title: Delhi law student held for intentionally hitting biker with Scorpio car
162.article_body: A 25-year-old final-year law student from Delhi has been arrested after a video purportedly showed him speeding away after hitting a 22-year-old biker with his Scorpio car. The biker has claimed that the accused, who got into an argument with him, verbally abused and threatened him before intentionally hitting his bike. The law student's car has been seized.

163.title: Jailed leader Navjot Singh Sidhu hospitalised due to liver problems
163.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who was lodged in Patiala central jail, has been hospitalised due to liver-related problems, Chandigarh's PGIMER said. The hospital said that he required further evaluation and his condition is stable. Sidhu was last month sentenced to one year in jail over a 1988 road rage case that led to a man's death.

164.title: Fire at container depot in Bangladesh continues for 3rd day
164.article_body: A fire that left 41 people dead at a container depot in Bangladesh's Chittagong has continued to burn for the third day on Monday. Officials warned that there is a risk of further blasts if the flames spread to chemicals stored nearby. An official said that a container with hydrogen peroxide was identified as the possible source of the fire.

165.title: Will finish my term, won't run for re-election: Sri Lankan Prez
165.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday said that he will complete the remaining two years of his term but won't contest again, Bloomberg reported. "I can't go as a failed president...I have been given a mandate for five years," he said. His comments come as anti-government protesters have been demanding his ouster amid country's worst economic crisis since independence.

166.title: Teenage MP girl, uncle paraded with garlands of shoes for eloping; 8 held
166.article_body: A 17-year-old girl and her 48-year-old maternal uncle were allegedly abused and paraded with garlands of shoes around their necks in a village in Madhya Pradesh as punishment for eloping, police said. A case was registered and eight persons were arrested in this connection. The villagers allegedly abused the duo for the "immoral" act, police added, while quoting the FIR.

167.title: I started doing wicketkeeping as my father was a wicketkeeper too: Pant
167.article_body: Revealing how he became a wicketkeeper-batter, Rishabh Pant said, "As a kid, I started doing wicketkeeping because my father was a wicketkeeper too." The India wicketkeeper-batter added, "I have no idea if my wicketkeeping has got better or not, I am just trying to give my 100 percent every single day. I was always a wicketkeeper-batter."

168.title: Brazil begins talks with IAEA on nuclear fuel for planned submarine
168.article_body: International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) chief Rafael Grossi on Monday said that Brazil has initiated discussions with the UN watchdog aimed at eventually allowing it to use nuclear fuel in a submarine. Brazil plans to acquire a nuclear-powered submarine under a contract with a French company. Notably, nuclear-powered submarines can remain underwater and at sea for longer than other submarines.

169.title: Nuclear-capable ballistic missile Agni-4 successfully tested from Odisha
169.article_body: India successfully carried out a training launch of nuclear-capable intermediate-range ballistic missile Agni-4 from Odisha's APJ Abdul Kalam Island on Monday, the Defence Ministry said. "The successful test reaffirms India's policy of having a credible minimum deterrence capability," it added. The test is part of routine user training launches carried out under Strategic Forces Command's aegis.

170.title: Want to inculcate Dhoni's calmness, self-belief: SA all-rounder Pretorius
170.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa five-match T20I series, South Africa all-rounder Dwaine Pretorius said he'll try to bring MS Dhoni's calmness and self-belief into his game. Pretorius made his IPL debut for Dhoni-led CSK this year. On the upcoming series, Pretorius said, "Performances in this series is going to go far to secure a spot in the [T20] World Cup."

171.title: Why is UK PM Johnson facing a no-confidence vote today?
171.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson faces a no-confidence vote in the Parliament on Monday over the 'partygate' scandal. A video of Johnson's senior aides joking about breaking lockdown rules to attend a Christmas party was leaked online in December 2021. Parties involving alcohol were allegedly held in Downing Street during the height of COVID-19 lockdowns in 2020 and 2021.

172.title: England Test captaincy had become very unhealthy relationship: Root
172.article_body: Speaking about England Test captaincy, Joe Root stated it had become a "very unhealthy relationship", adding it was taking a bad toll on his personal health. "I couldn't leave it at...ground any more; it was coming home," Root said. Root, who was replaced by Ben Stokes, led England in 64 Tests, winning 27 and losing 26 during his five-year tenure.

173.title: 20-year-old man arrested for 'needle attacks' in France
173.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested in southern France on Sunday after being accused of attacking people with needles. The accused was charged two days after 20 people reported needle injuries during the filming of a televised concert in Toulon. As many as 100 incidents of 'needle injuries' at French nightclubs and festivals have been reported since beginning of this year.

174.title: It's time to send an IAS officer to jail: High Court on officials not obeying orders
174.article_body: Karnataka High Court expressed displeasure over government officials not following court orders and observed, "It's time an IAS officer is sent to jail." It also observed that officers were not taking court orders seriously. The court said this after the state government failed to implement a July, 2021 court order regarding merging of Group-C with Group-B jobs in municipalities.

175.title: I was asked to have no expression for passport photo: Shabana Azmi
