"He does not believe in the atrocities on Kashmiri Pandits and takes support from Khalistani supporters to form a government in Punjab," Thakur added.

350.title: People asked me if I sniff cocaine in real since Aashram scene: Adhyayan
350.article_body: Actor Adhyayan Suman, speaking about his role in the 'Aashram' series, said it was similar to that of Shahid Kapoor in 'Udta Punjab'. However, he added he didn't want to "ape" Shahid in any way. He further revealed, "People have even asked me whether I sniff cocaine in real life since that scene of mine in the 'Aashram' series became...popular!"

351.title: Pro-Khalistan slogans, Bhindranwale posters raised outside Golden Temple
351.article_body: A group of people gathered at the entrance of the Golden Temple in Punjab's Amritsar and raised pro-Khalistan slogans on the anniversary of Operation Bluestar on Monday. The group also carried  posters of Khalistani separatist Jarnail Bhindranwale. Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann had last week reviewed the law and order situation in the state ahead of the Operation Bluestar anniversary.

352.title: Rapes have come down because PM Modi gave women toilets: Sambit Patra
352.article_body: BJP national spokesperson Sambit Patra said that rapes have come down in many states because Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave toilets to women. He reportedly said that rapes happened when women in rural areas used to go out to attend nature's call in the dark. "Modi is the first Prime Minister in the world who talked about toilets," he added.

353.title: 'Always' actor Brad Johnson dies due to COVID-19 complications
353.article_body: Actor Brad Johnson, known for his role in Steven Spielberg's romantic drama 'Always', has passed away aged 62. His representative Linda McAlister told The Hollywood Reporter that Brad died of complications from COVID-19 on February 18 in Fort Worth, Texas. "He lived life to the fullest and taught his children to do the same," his family said in a statement.

354.title: It is a trouble-engine not double-engine govt in Bihar: Tejashwi
354.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday criticised CM Nitish Kumar-led NDA government in Bihar, saying, "Some...say it's a double-engine government in Bihar. But it's a trouble-engine government."  In Bihar, inflation is high, farmers are in "distress" and "no one talks about labourers and unemployment", he claimed. RJD is the only regional party that hasn't "compromised" with BJP, he also claimed.

355.title: We respect him a lot, truly unbelievable: Williamson on Root's 10,000 Test runs
355.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson has praised Joe Root for taking England "over the line" in the first Test at Lord's. "It was a fantastic game, finely balanced...[and] Joe took them over the line. Absolutely (we respect him a lot in New Zealand). Truly unbelievable achievement (10,000 Test runs)," stated Kane. Root smashed his 26th Test hundred in the game.

356.title: Mandy Moore expecting second child with husband Taylor Goldsmith
356.article_body: American singer-actress Mandy Moore took to Instagram to share that she is expecting her second child with husband Taylor Goldsmith. She shared a picture of her son August Harrison Goldsmith wearing a t-shirt with 'big brother' printed on it. "Baby Boy Goldsmith #2 coming this fall...Gus is [going to] be the BEST big brother," Mandy wrote.

357.title: India reports 4,518 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases rise to 25,782
357.article_body: India has reported 4,518 COVID-19 cases, 2,779 recoveries and 9 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,270 COVID-19 cases and 15 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 25,782, while the death toll reached 5,24,701.

358.title: Who is Nupur Sharma, whose remarks made 3 nations call Indian envoys?
358.article_body: Former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma is a graduate in economics from Delhi University's Hindu College and also studied LLB from DU before completing her Master's degree in law from the London School of Economics. In 2008, she won the post of Delhi University Students' Union President. In 2015 Delhi Assembly election, she lost to Arvind Kejriwal from New Delhi constituency.

359.title: Only ICMR-accredited labs to conduct COVID-19 tests: DDMA
359.article_body: The Delhi Disaster Management Authority has directed that only ICMR-accredited labs can collect samples for COVID-19 tests in the national capital. "The personnel being employed by labs should be adequately qualified as per the qualifications fixed by ICMR/NABL or any authorised agency," said DDMA. It also directed the district magistrates to conduct surprise inspections of labs.

360.title: 2 players get retired out in same T20 match for the first time in history
360.article_body: The T20 Blast 2022 match between Birmingham Bears and Nottinghamshire marked the first instance of two players getting retired out in the same T20 match. The match which was reduced to eight-overs-a-side game saw Birmingham Bears' Carlos Brathwaite retiring out for 17(11) ahead of the last over. Meanwhile, Nottinghamshire's Samit Patel was retired out for 2(2).

361.title: French Open final vs Nadal is something I'll tell my grandkids about: Casper Ruud
361.article_body: Casper Ruud, who lost the French Open final against Rafael Nadal, has said he'll remember the match for the rest of his career and tell his grandkids about it. "I wish I could make the match closer...but at the end of the day...I'm going to enjoy this moment for a long time," he added. Nadal defeated Casper 6-3, 6-3, 6-0.

362.title: We've some people in TMC who pass on information to us: WB BJP chief
362.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said his party has some people in TMC who pass on information to them. "In fact, every party plants its men in other parties to remain privy to crucial decisions taken by its political opponents," he added. Reacting to his remark, TMC's Kunal Ghosh said, "No one believes what he (Majumdar) says now."

363.title: Noida woman cheated of ₹2.64 lakh by man she met on social media
363.article_body: A Noida woman was allegedly cheated of ₹2.64 lakh by a man, claiming to be German, she befriended on social media. He said he would meet her in Goa. Later, he claimed to have been detained by customs officials for carrying 50,000 pounds in cash meant for her. The woman was then asked to pay for his release.

364.title: I'm doing exactly what other heroines are doing today: Ankita Lokhande
364.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande said that she is confident about herself and added that it doesn't matter if she does a big film or not. "I'm doing today exactly what other heroines are doing, I'm looking as well, dressing in the same clothes, I'm a good actor and dancer too," she stated. "I'm...confident about myself, I don't need people," she added.

365.title: Twitter user shares video of men wheeling on B'luru road, police respond
365.article_body:
A Twitter user shared a video of two men on a scooty, wheeling in Bengaluru. "@BlrCityPolice
wheeling between Hosakerehalli and Somapura on NICE road this afternoon. What was also unfortunate was [that] just 5 kms from this place, there was an interceptor catching speeding vehicles and it appears these guys were fully aware," the tweet read.

366.title: Pune's SPPU to get ₹10 crore to build pool, other facilities
366.article_body: The Maharashtra government has allocated ₹10 crore to Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) to build infrastructure and sports facilities, including a swimming pool. The fund will also be used to develop a memorial of the leader, Savitribai Phule. Announcing the decision, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said that all necessary help to upgrade the sports complex in SPPU will be given.

367.title: Dad got letters saying 'Want to marry you' after mom's death: Nargis' daughter
367.article_body: Late actors Sunil Dutt and Nargis' daughter Priya Dutt said after her mother Nargis passed away, her father got letters from women saying they want to marry him and that they would take care of his children. "Once we told him, 'Dad if you like someone...it's okay...We will understand'...He laughed and said, 'I haven't found...anyone like your mother'," Priya added.

368.title: Govt plans to revamp New Delhi Railway Station on its own: Report
368.article_body: The Centre is reportedly planning to undertake the New Delhi Railway Station's revamp project completely by themselves instead of doing it under the PPP model. A ₹4,700 crore plan is currently undergoing evaluation where the Centre is looking to directly fund the Engineering Procurement and Construction contracts. Notably, a six-floor station complex is planned as part of the redevelopment.

369.title: B'luru reports 1st COVID-19 death in June as new cases rise to 291
369.article_body: Bengaluru recorded 291 new coronavirus cases and one death on Sunday, according to BBMP data. This is the first death reported in June due to the virus. The number of active clusters in the city is currently 12, while the positivity rate is 1.62%, the data showed. The city reported 142 recoveries the same day, the data also showed.

370.title: He wanted Broad to go and have a slog: Stokes on McCullum's strategy vs NZ
370.article_body: After winning the first Test against New Zealand, England Test captain Ben Stokes revealed that head coach Brendon McCullum wanted Stuart Broad to bat if Joe Root or Ben Foakes had lost their wicket during their chase of NZ's 277-run target. "That's the kind of stuff that we're not used to in the dressing room," Stokes added.

371.title: Duo attacks man over suspected affair with one of their ex-girlfriends in Pune
371.article_body: Two men, aged 24 and 25, allegedly attacked a 20-year-old man with sharp weapons on suspicion that the latter was having an affair with one of the duo's former girlfriends in Pune, according to the police. One accused was arrested, while the police are looking for the other. The victim was taken to a hospital and his condition is stable.

372.title: Centre in denial, wants everyone to pretend all is well in J&K: Farooq
372.article_body: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said the central government is living in "denial" and it wants everyone to keep their heads down and pretend all is well in Kashmir, including Kashmiri Pandits. Speaking about the recent incidents of violence in the Valley, Abdullah said, "They (central government) want to project normalcy to the world when it is the exact opposite."

373.title: Hire for real tech skills with Scaler Enterprise: Scaler
373.article_body: EdTech startup, Scaler, launches a hiring portal, Scaler Enterprise, with a campaign highlighting the importance of real tech skills. It aims to aid CTOs, Senior Engineers, and Recruiters in finding problem-solvers who are fit to scale their product, said Scaler. It added that it is key to look beyond hiring biases to build a team with top tech potential.

374.title: Saudi Arabia condemns ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad
374.article_body: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia has said in a statement that it expresses its condemnation of the statements made by the former BJP spokesperson, Nupur Sharma, insulting Prophet Muhammad. Earlier, Qatar, Kuwait and Iran summoned Indian ambassadors to condemn Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Mohammed.

375.title: Ronaldo's mother tears up as he scores goal for Portugal, pics go viral
375.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo's mother teared up after he scored a goal for Portugal against Switzerland in a Nations League match. Pictures of Ronaldo's mother getting emotional in the stands have gone viral. Ronaldo scored two goals in the match as Portugal beat Switzerland 4-0. Ronaldo has now scored 117 goals in international football.

376.title: I was shocked that he didn't run: Riyan Parag on giving 'death stare' to Ashwin
376.article_body: Opening up on giving a 'death stare' to Ravichandran Ashwin after getting run out against GT in IPL 2022 Qualifier 1, Riyan Parag said, "It would've been fine if Ashwin was batting with tail-ender. He should run when I'm batting. I was shocked." He added, "Later, Ashwin came to me and said sorry because he was thinking something...and didn’t run."

377.title: Pune's Rohan Pethe bags 5th rank in UPSC, to join Indian Air Force
377.article_body: Pune resident Rohan Pethe bagged the fifth rank in the Combined Defence Services Examination conducted by the UPSC. He has been selected to join the flying branch of the Indian Air Force. A final year engineering student from Vishwakarma Institute of Technology, Pune, Pethe will be the third-generation officer from his family to join the military.

378.title: ED raids Satyendar Jain's home in alleged money laundering case
378.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted searches at residence of Delhi's Health Minister Satyendar Jain in connection with hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company. Jain was arrested in the case on May 30. CBI had earlier alleged that Jain and his family set up four shell firms to launder ₹11.78 crore in 2010-12 and ₹4.63 crore in 2015-16.

379.title: 8 water ATMs in Pune Cantonment area lying defunct since 2019
379.article_body: A total of eight water ATMs installed in eight wards of Pune Cantonment area in 2016-17 are lying defunct since past three years. "Due to lack of timely service and attention by [Pune Cantonment Board (PCB)], these ATMs have become defunct," a resident said. Some components need to be changed otherwise it'll affect water quality, said PCB CEO Subrat Pal.

380.title: Fake intl call centre cheating US citizens busted in Delhi; 4 arrested
380.article_body: A fake international call centre operating in Delhi, which allegedly cheated US citizens on the pretext of providing them with technical support from Microsoft, has been busted and four people have been arrested. Police said the accused cheated their targets by inducing them to pay money for solving a non-existent problem. They sometimes also made their targets buy gift cards.

381.title: Rafael Nadal and French Open, the romance continues: Ojha
381.article_body: Taking to Twitter following world number five Rafael Nadal's record-extending 14th French Open win on Sunday, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha wrote, "Nadal and French Open, the romance continues." Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag tweeted, "King of clay. What a Champion. Nadal. Number 14 at Roland Garros." Roger Federer's coach Ivan Ljubicic said, "There is no word to describe this feat."

382.title: Winning 14th French Open title is amazing, means everything: Nadal
382.article_body: Talking about his record-extending 14th French Open title, 36-year-old Rafael Nadal said it's "amazing" and means everything. "Much more probably emotional than the first time because [it's] completely unexpected to be where I am at this age, at this stage of my career." It's Nadal's 22nd Grand Slam title. At 19, he won the 2005 French Open on his debut.

383.title: Russian plane's detention in Sri Lanka is private legal issue: PM
383.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has informed Russia that the detention of an Aeroflot aircraft in Colombo is a private legal matter. The Russian flag carrier has suspended flights to Sri Lanka in response. Reportedly, a company owning the plane claimed that Aeroflot had continued to fly the aircraft despite the lease agreement between them being terminated in March.

384.title: A modern day Hercules: Shastri to Nadal on his 14th French Open win
384.article_body: Reacting to Rafael Nadal's record-extending 14th French Open title, Ravi Shastri tweeted, "A modern day Hercules who just will not melt in...hottest claypot. Starts favourite to make it 15 only. Just insane. Salute forever." Nadal's 6-3, 6-3, 6-0 win over eighth-seeded Casper Ruud gave him a record-extending 22nd Grand Slam title. Nadal is now 112-3 win-loss lifetime at Roland Garros.

385.title: Salman's father found threat letter on bench where he sits daily: Police
385.article_body: The threat letter sent to actor Salman Khan and his father Salim Khan was found by the latter on a bench where he sits daily after jogging, police said. Salim Khan found the letter at 7.30-8.00 am on Sunday morning near Bandra Bandstand Promenade in Mumbai, police added. An FIR against an unknown person has been filed.

386.title: Ankita, Vicky crowned winners of Smart Jodi, win ₹25-lakh cash prize
386.article_body: Smart Jodi contestants Ankita Lokhande and Vicky Jain were announced as the winners of the show on Sunday. They took home a 'golden gathbandhan' frame and a ₹25 lakh cash prize. Comedian Balraj and his wife, singer Deepti, were announced as the first runners-up. The Star Plus show which lasted eight weeks, was hosted by Maniesh Paul.

387.title: After Qatar & Kuwait, Iran summons Indian envoy over BJP leader's remark against Prophet
387.article_body: After Qatar and Kuwait, Iran has also summoned the Indian ambassador to condemn and reject a BJP leader's remarks against Prophet Mohammed. The state media called it an "insult against Prophet of Islam in an Indian TV show". This comes ahead of Iranian Foreign Minister's first-ever trip to India next week.

388.title: Joe Root becomes joint-youngest batter to reach 10,000 Test runs, breaks Sachin's record
388.article_body: Former England captain Joe Root has become the joint-youngest batter to reach 10,000 runs in Test cricket. Root completed 10,000 runs in Test cricket at the age of 31 years and 157 days, equalling Alastair Cook's record. He overtook Sachin Tendulkar, who had reached the 10,000-run mark at the age of 31 years and 326 days.

389.title: Look into this: FM to LIC as 17-yr-old orphan gets notices to repay ₹29 lakh loan
389.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has asked LIC to look into the matter of a 17-year-old orphan girl receiving legal notices from the state-run insurer to repay ₹29 lakh on a home loan taken by her father. Vanisha lost both her parents to COVID-19 during the second wave. LIC has blocked her father's savings as Vanisha is a minor, TOI reported.

390.title: Spain to deliver anti-aircraft missiles & tanks to Ukraine: Report
390.article_body: Spain will supply anti-aircraft missiles and tanks to Ukraine as it seeks to boost its military support to the country, according to government sources cited by a local newspaper. Spain will also provide essential training to Ukraine's military in how to use the tanks, it claimed. Spain has supplied ammunition, individual protection equipment and light weapons to Ukraine so far.

391.title: VP Naidu launches India-Qatar Start-Up bridge in Doha
391.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday launched the "India-Qatar Start-Up bridge" at the India-Qatar Business Forum in Doha to link the startup ecosystems of the two countries. "We have now a very robust India-Qatar economic partnership and it's getting enriched with each passing day," Naidu said. Number of Indian businesses in Qatar has also increased, he added.

392.title: Swiatek's reaction after seeing Robert Lewandowski in French Open final crowd goes viral
392.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek's reaction after seeing footballer Robert Lewandowski in the French Open women's singles final crowd has gone viral. The eventual winner Swiatek was visibly surprised to see Lewandowski. "He has been a top athlete in our country for so many years...it's hard to believe that he came to watch me. Just overawed," Swiatek said.

393.title: 4 injured as clash erupts between 2 groups in Gujarat's Surendranagar
393.article_body: At least four persons were injured in a clash between two upper-class groups in Gujarat's Surendranagar on Sunday, police said. According to a villager, the clash broke out over a dispute on passing through a road between two-three fields. As per reports, one of the groups also attacked a house nearby and broke vehicles parked there.

394.title: Huge inspiration for sporting world: ABD on Nadal's record 14th French Open
394.article_body: After Rafael Nadal beat eighth-seeded Casper Ruud to win a record-extending 14th French Open, AB de Villiers said the Spaniard is a "huge inspiration for the sporting world!" He added, "I hope all youngsters were watching, especially...pre and post match respect between opponents and to the sport." The 36-year-old has also claimed a men's all-time record 22nd Grand Slam title.

395.title: Thai Police rescue 59 Rohingya refugees from island near Malaysia
395.article_body: The police in Thailand on Sunday said that they had rescued 59 Rohingya refugees who had been abandoned by people smugglers from a Thai island near Malaysia. "The boat driver told them they had arrived in Malaysia and left them on the island a few days ago," they added. The refugees include 23 women and five children.

396.title: Police insert stick in UP man's rectum, give electric shocks; pay him ₹100 later
396.article_body: Five policemen have been booked in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun for allegedly torturing a man they arrested in connection with cattle slaughter case. The victim's mother said the policemen shoved a stick inside the man's rectum and gave him repeated electric shocks. She added that policemen paid him ₹100 before releasing him after they realised they arrested the wrong person.

397.title: BJP becoming 'Cong-yukt': AAP after 4 ex-Punjab Cong ministers join BJP
397.article_body: AAP on Sunday said BJP which used to talk about a "Congress-mukt Bharat (Congress-free India)" is itself becoming "Congress-yukt (filled with Congress)". This comes a day after four former Punjab Congress ministers joined BJP. AAP leader Malvinder Singh Kang also accused BJP of double standards, stating that it welcomed many Congress leaders against whom it had levelled several charges earlier.

398.title: Ranveer, Salman & Aamir attend Ambani event hosted for Anant's fiancee Radhika
398.article_body: Actors Ranveer Singh, Salman Khan and Aamir Khan were seen at an Arangetram event hosted by Nita and Mukesh Ambani for their son Anant Ambani's fiancee Radhika Merchant on Sunday. The event is traditionally hosted for the debut dance performance of a trained Bharatanatyam dancer. Ambanis hosted the event at Jio World Centre in Mumbai.

399.title: 'Mr Dependable' Root, what a player: Stokes on England's 1st Test win vs NZ
399.article_body: Following England's five-wicket win against New Zealand in first Test, England captain Ben Stokes said no one had the upper hand and the way his side handled pressure in fourth innings on a "difficult" wicket at Lord's was fantastic. "And obviously 'Mr dependable', Joe Root, stood up. Scoring a hundred and 10,000 runs- what a player...what a man," he added.

400.title: Delhi's maximum temperature reaches 47°C for 2nd straight day
400.article_body: The maximum temperature reached 47°C in Delhi's Mungeshpur for the second consecutive day on Sunday amid a heatwave in the national capital, the India Meteorological Department said. Jafarpur, Najafgarh, Ridge and Pitampura observatories recorded over 45°C. On Saturday, the highest maximum temperature in Delhi was recorded at Mungeshpur at 47.1°C.

401.title: Fringe elements' view, not our govt's: India to Kuwait over BJP leader's remark on Prophet
401.article_body: After Kuwait condemned BJP leader's remarks on Prophet Mohammed and sought India's apology, Indian embassy in Kuwait released a statement, saying that the offensive tweets were fringe elements' view. "The tweets do not, in any manner, reflect the views of the Government of India...Strong action has been taken," India stated. BJP suspended Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal over remarks.

402.title: Unseeded Garcia-Mladenovic win their 2nd French Open title as a team
402.article_body: Unseeded French pair of Caroline Garcia and Kristina Mladenovic have clinched their second French Open women's doubles title together. The 2016 champions defeated eighth seeds Coco Gauff and Jessica Pegula of America 2-6, 6-3, 6-2 in final on Sunday. Overall, this is Mladenovic's fourth French Open women's doubles title, having won it in 2019 and 2020 alongside Hungary's Timea Babos.

403.title: Indian Railways cancelled nearly 9,000 train services this year
403.article_body: The Indian Railways cancelled nearly 9,000 train services this year, according to an RTI reply. Of these, more than 1,900 train services were cancelled from March to May for the movement of coal, the Railways said. The Railways also said that it had cancelled 6,995 train services for maintenance work or for construction purposes.
